info.title: RPC - System Operations
info.description:
Cisco IOS-XE RPC Operations - System

**Category:** System Operations
**Modules:** 5
**RPC Actions:** 20

**HTTP Methods:**
- POST: Execute RPC action/operation

**Modules Included:**
- cli
- cli-preview
- install
- rescue-config
- verify

**RPC Operation Pattern:**
RPC operations are executed via RESTCONF POST to `/operations/` endpoints.
Each RPC accepts input parameters and returns output results.

**Example RPC Execution:**
```bash
POST /restconf/operations/Cisco-IOS-XE-rpc:ping
Content-Type: application/yang-data+json

{
  "input": {
    "ping-request": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "repeat-count": 5,
      "size": 100
    }
  }
}
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "output": {
    "ping-reply": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "request-count": 5,
      "reply-count": 5,
      "success-rate": 100,
      "minimum-rtt": 1,
      "average-rtt": 2,
      "maximum-rtt": 3
    }
  }
}
```

**Common Operations:**
- cli_preview_rpc:cli-preview
- cli_rpc:config-ios-cli-rpc
- cli_rpc:config-ios-cli-trans
- cli_rpc:get-modelled-config-clis
- install_rpc:install
...

post.summary:
The configuration CLI preview RPC accepts NETCONF XML encoded
       configuration based on YANG model schemas. It will return a
       preview of the IOS-XE command-line interface (CLI) configuration
       commands needed to apply the configuration. The returned commands
       depend on the device's current configuration state and will vary
       if the device's configuration changes. The configuration will not
       be applied to the device.
post.description:
**Source Module:** cli-preview

The configuration CLI preview RPC accepts NETCONF XML encoded
       configuration based on YANG model schemas. It will return a
       preview of the IOS-XE command-line interface (CLI) configuration
       commands needed to apply the configuration. The returned commands
       depend on the device's current configuration state and will vary
       if the device's configuration changes. The configuration will not
       be applied to the device.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cli_preview_rpc:cli-preview`

config-xml.description:
This leaf accepts a NETCONF XML <config> tag holding configuration
         data corresponding to the device's YANG models similar to the
         <edit-config> RPC.

         For example:
         <config>
         ...
         </config>

         The target datastore is the 'running' datastore. The 'candidate'
         datastore is not supported.

         This leaf is defined to be of type 'string' and the input XML will
         need to be escaped when this RPC is executed using NETCONF.

custom-timeout.description:
The time required to generate a configuration CLI preview will
         vary with the input configuration. This leaf allows the client
         to specify how long it is willing to wait for a preview operation
         to complete up to a maximum of 600 seconds. If this leaf is not
         explicitly set the default value of 60 seconds will apply.

config-xml.description:
This leaf accepts a NETCONF XML <config> tag holding configuration
         data corresponding to the device's YANG models similar to the
         <edit-config> RPC.

         For example:
         <config>
         ...
         </config>

         The target datastore is the 'running' datastore. The 'candidate'
         datastore is not supported.

         This leaf is defined to be of type 'string' and the input XML will
         need to be escaped when this RPC is executed using NETCONF.

config-cli.description:
A preview of the IOS-XE command-line interface (CLI) configuration
         commands needed to apply the input configuration. The returned
         commands depend on the device's current configuration state and will
         vary if the device's configuration changes.

post.summary: Configure CLIs directly to the IOS, bypassing NETCONF transaction
post.description:
**Source Module:** cli

Configure CLIs directly to the IOS, bypassing NETCONF transaction

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cli_rpc:config-ios-cli-rpc`

error-tag.description:
Tag returned in the response if parser response matches
           the error-pattern

error-pattern.description: error pattern to check against the parser response.

result.description: Output returned by the network element

lineno.description: line number of the failed CLI

error-code.description: Error code returned by the parser

error-tag.description: supplied error tag that matched the error-pattern

post.summary:
Configure using modelled config CLI.
       Wireless,  app-hosting, telemetry features are not
       supported through this RPC.
post.description:
**Source Module:** cli

Configure using modelled config CLI.
       Wireless,  app-hosting, telemetry features are not
       supported through this RPC.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cli_rpc:config-ios-cli-trans`

do-commit.description:
Copy the CLI commands from candidate datastore
           to running datastore in candidate mode.

operation.description:
Operations have the following effects:
           merge: append the supplied contents of this RPC into the
                  currently configured datastore
           selective-replace: overwrite the submode config of the
                              specified cli in the currently
                              configured datastore with the
                              contents of this RPC (supported
                              use only covers submode modification)
           full-replace: overwrite the complete configuration
                         stored in the configured datastore with
                         the contents of this RPC

result.description: Output returned by the network element

error-message.description: Error returned by the network element

post.summary:
Retrieve configuration in CLI format from Running or Candidate
       datastore. Wireless, app-hosting, telemetry features are not
       supported through this RPC.
post.description:
**Source Module:** cli

Retrieve configuration in CLI format from Running or Candidate

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cli_rpc:get-modelled-config-clis`

error-message.description: Error returned by the network element

post.description:
**Source Module:** install

Software install action command

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/install_rpc:install`

vpn.description:
The VPN ID is used to indicate device to select the interface
         for the image download

uuid.description:
The UUID (universally unique identifier) is a string and is a textual
         representation of a UUID.
         UUID is used to uniquely identify the install action invoked via RPC
         and it is replayed back in the install progress notifications to correlate
         them back to the original install operation.

one-shot.description: Software activate and commit in one shot

reloadfast.description: This leaf is obsolete. Use new leaf xfsu in the future

issu.description: Perform one shot In Service Software Upgrade (ISSU)

download-timeout.description:
Download timeout is used on device from initiating image download request
         to complete from remote repository. The image download timeout value is
         in minutes and in range between 1 and 1440

xfsu.description: Perform one shot Extended Fast Software Upgrade (xFSU)

scheduled-start.description: Scheduled start time for image install

scheduled-end.description: Scheduled end time for image install

name.description:
Install profile is used in the wireless image
             upgrade workflow. Currently it is only used in EWC 9100
             wireless platform for AP pre-image download using profile
             on device to upgrade APs in network. Profile name is string

vpn.description:
The VPN ID is used to indicate device to select the interface
         for the image download

post.description:
**Source Module:** install

Software activate action command

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/install_rpc:activate`

uuid.description:
The UUID (universally unique identifier) is a string and is a textual
         representation of a UUID.
         UUID is used to uniquely identify the install action invoked via RPC
         and it is replayed back in the install progress notifications to correlate
         them back to the original install operation.

auto-abort-timer-val.description:
Option to change default auto abort wait timer during image
         activate action. The timer value is in minutes and
         in range between 30 and 1200 minutes. Image activate will
         auto abort if action is not confirmed through commit.

one-shot.description: Software activate and commit in one shot

issu.description: Perform activation via In Service Software Upgrade (ISSU)

scheduled-start.description: Scheduled start time for image activate

scheduled-end.description: Scheduled end time for image activate

post.summary:
The set-default RPC is used to set the default image in controller mode.
       This RPC is only applicable in controller mode. The default image will
       be set if this RPC executes successfully
post.description:
**Source Module:** install

The set-default RPC is used to set the default image in controller mode.
       This RPC is only applicable in controller mode. The default image will
       be set if this RPC executes successfully

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/install_rpc:set-default`

version.description: Software image version to set as default

uuid.description:
The UUID (universally unique identifier) is a string and is a textual
         representation of a UUID.
         UUID is used to uniquely identify the install action invoked via RPC
         and it is replayed back in the install progress notifications to correlate
         them back to the original install operation.

post.summary:
This RPC is to be used for calculating checksum of a given file.
       Also one can provide previously calculated hash and match against the given file.
post.description:
**Source Module:** verify

This RPC is to be used for calculating checksum of a given file.
       Also one can provide previously calculated hash and match against the given file.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/verify_rpc:verify`

uuid.description:
The UUID is unique identifier generated per request. This is used
         in combination with event model, where event notification provide request specific UUID in it.
         This is useful in matching a  request with event notification.
